name: treatment of damaged clay roof tile, glazed, open dump | damaged clay roof tile, glazed | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/28359/documentation

This dataset represents the activity of waste disposal of 'damaged clay roof tile, glazed' in an open dump. Recommended use of this dataset: uncontrolled disposal of the waste through dumping.  Inventoried waste consists of fraction: glazed clay roof tiles contain clay (98.79%), lead oxide (0.97%) and silica sand (0.24%) . Waste composition (wet, in ppmw): H2O na; O 497460; H na; C 1880.2; S 0.22404; N na; P na; B na; Cl na; Br na; F na; I na; Ag na; As na; Ba 0.12042; Cd na; Co na; Cr 0.87338; Cu na; Hg na; Mn na; Mo na; Ni na; Pb 8980.4; Sb na; Se na; Sn na; V na; Zn 0.077078; Be na; Sc na; Sr na; Ti 1.2793; Tl na; W na; Si 349710; Fe 38387; Ca 6063.7; Al 73527; K 12596; Mg 7917.8; Na 3468. Share of carbon in initial waste that is biogenic 0%. Share of metals in waste not oxidised and bulk-recyclable (exclude very small or thin parts) Iron: 0%; Alu: 0%; Copper: 0%. Overall degradability of waste during 100 years: 0%. 0.3481 kg waste mass remains in the landfill even after the long term period.;Reference for elemental composition of waste:;ÇÖĞÜRCÜ, M.T. and Mehmet, U.Z.U.N., 2021. The Taguchi optimization of mechanical and durability properties of accelerator added concrete. Politeknik Dergisi, pp.1-1.;ŠVEDA, M. and SOKOLÁŘ, R., 2013. The effect of firing temperature on the irreversible expansion, water absorption and pore structure of a brick body during freeze-thaw cycles. Materials Science, 19(4), pp.465-470.

The activity starts with the waste being available at the location (gate) of the uncontrolled disposal. Collection and transportation of the waste to the treatment plant is not included.

The activity ends with the waste being disposed, in an uncontrolled manner and waste-specific emissions from open dump are released to air via gas and to water via leachate.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset represents an open dump location with mean annual temperature (MAT) of 21.39 degC, mean annual precipitation (MAP) of 2274 mm/year, and net infiltration of 1287 mm/year. This infiltration was soft capped from a value of 1338.3 mm/year. The implied surface runoff of water is therefore 51.288 mm/year. The leachate percolating through the landfill has an average residence time of 1.36 years.;Reference for climatic parameters:;World Bank, 2022. Average precipitation in depth (mm per year), World Bank Group Available at: https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/AG.LND.PRCP.MM?end=2019&start=2019;World Bank, 2021. Observed Climatology of Mean-Temperature 1991-2020 Ecuador, Climate Change Knowledge Portal for Development Practisioners and Policy Makers, The World Bank Group Available at: https://climateknowledgeportal.worldbank.org/country/ecuador/climate-data-historical;undata, 2020. Actual evapotranspiration, United Nations Statistics Division Available at: http://data.un.org/Data.aspx?d=ENV&f=variableID%3a7;World Bank, 2022. Surface area (sq.km), World Bank Group Available at: https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/AG.SRF.TOTL.K2)
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This is an inventory for an open, uncontrolled waste dump for municipal solid waste. Ultimate average landfill height is 7 meters. Operation phase duration is 15 years. Percentage of landfill gas directly emitted is 100w%. A Methane Correction Factor (MCF) for landfill air emissions of 0.7057 is employed. Leachate of the landfill is not treated, but emitted untreated. Based on average waste composition and chosen climate data the end of carbonate phase is estimated to be reached 691 years after waste deposition.
